meanings.definition: A container made of metal for storing food or other items.
meanings.sent1: I bought some tins to store my cookies.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen shelves were filled with tins of soup and beans.
meanings.sent3: When the cat knocked over the tins, it sounded like a mini drum concert.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a tin, holding memories of a distant past.
meanings.sent5: The tins gleamed in the sunlight, a metallic rainbow on the shelf.

meanings.definition: To coat or plate with tin.
meanings.sent1: The craftsman tins the new pots for the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: She carefully tins the edges of the metal sheet for protection.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally tins his fingers while working on the project.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight tins the world in a silvery glow.
meanings.sent5: The artist tins the sculpture, giving it a shiny finish.

meanings.definition: To preserve or pack in tins.
meanings.sent1: They tin the fruits to keep them fresh for a long time.
meanings.sent2: The company tins the fish in high-quality containers for export.
meanings.sent3: She tins her memories in little boxes, neatly organized.
meanings.sent4: His laughter tins the room with joy and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly tinned coffee filled the kitchen.
